column4: Market Chatter-Corporate finance press digest
column5: Aug 15 The following corporate finance-related stories were reported by media on Thursday:

column4: Verizon delays acquisitions of Canadian wireless firms -report
column5: Aug 14 Verizon Communications Inc has decided to put off the acquisition of two small Canadian wireless companies until after a government auction of wireless licenses in January  a Canadian newspaper said  citing people familiar with the matter.

column4: US STOCKS-Wall St posts biggest drop since June on weak results
column5: * Wal-Mart slumps after sales decline; Cisco drags on tech shares

column4: Wal-Mart sales disappoint as U.S. shoppers curb spending
column5: Wal-Mart Stores Inc  reported a surprise decline in quarterly same-store sales in the United States  its biggest market  after shoppers came in less often because higher taxes and gasoline prices were leaving them with less spending money. | Video

column4: US STOCKS-Cisco  Wal-Mart lead broad selloff on Wall Street
column5: * Wal-Mart slumps after results; Cisco drags on technology

column4: UPDATE 3-Wal-Mart sales disappoint as U.S. shoppers curb spending
column5: Aug 15 Wal-Mart Stores Inc reported a surprise decline in quarterly same-store sales in the United States  its biggest market  after shoppers came in less often because higher taxes and gasoline prices were leaving them with less spending money.

column4: US STOCKS-Wall Street drops  weighed by Wal-Mart  Cisco
column5: NEW YORK  Aug 15 U.S. stocks fell on Thursday  as investors weighed disappointing results from blue chips Wal-Mart and Cisco  along with sturdy economic data that looked set to place the Federal Reserve on a path soon toward scaling back its stimulus.

column4: Kohl's same-store sales increase  shares rise
column5: Department store chain Kohl's Corp  reported a rise in quarterly comparable-store sales  boosting its shares  after downbeat sales reports from Wal-Mart Stores Inc  and Macy's Inc  raised fears of a slowdown in consumer spending.

column4: UPDATE 1-Kohl's same-store sales increase  shares rise
column5: * 2nd-quarter earnings/share $1.04  in line with estimates

column4: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Wall St opens down; Cisco weighs on Nasdaq
column5: NEW YORK  Aug 15 U.S. stocks opened lower on Thursday on continued uncertainty over the next policy move by the Federal Reserve and after Wal-Mart earnings disappointed. The Nasdaq fell more than 1 percent  dragged down by shares of Cisco.

column4: CANADA STOCKS-TSX may open lower  Fed uncertainity drags
column5: August 15 Canadian main stock index futures pointed to a lower open on Thursday  after closing flat in the previous session  as lack of clarity about the Federal Reserve's monetary stimulus program kept inventors on edge.

column4: US STOCKS-Futures slip as Fed uncertainty lingers
column5: NEW YORK  Aug 15 U.S. stock index futures fell on Thursday on continued uncertainty over when  and how quickly  the Federal Reserve will begin to wind down its program to stimulate the world's largest economy.

column4: CORRECTED-Berkshire Hathaway raises stake in Wells Fargo  takes position in Dish
column5: (Corrects to show that Berkshire increased its holding in Wells Fargo  not cut; Removes Coca-Cola and American Express  for which there was no change; Corrects headline to conform)
